Application-specific context for the cancelation check function.
maximum # candidates for a line
maximum # candidates for a point
maximum # candidates for a polygon
show partial labels (cut-off by the map canvas) or not
Create an new pal instance.
Pal cannot be copied.

memberdef.argsstring: (QgsAbstractLabelProvider *provider, const QString &layerName, QgsPalLayerSettings::Placement arrangement, double defaultPriority, bool active, bool toLabel, bool displayAll=false)
memberdef.name: addLayer

briefdescription.para: add a new layer

parameterdescription.para: layer's prioriry (0 is the best, 1 the worst)
is the layer is active (currently displayed)
the layer will be labeled only if toLablel is true
if true, all features will be labelled even though overlaps occur

briefdescription.para: Extracts the labeling problem for the specified map extent - only features within this extent will be considered.

detaileddescription.para: The mapBoundary argument specifies the actual geometry of the map boundary, which will be used to detect whether a label is visible (or partially visible) in the rendered map. This may differ from extent in the case of rotated or non-rectangular maps.

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of candidates to generate for line features.
Returns the number of candidates to generate for point features.
Returns the number of candidates to generate for polygon features.
Returns the search method in use.
Returns whether partial labels should be allowed.
Check whether the job has been canceled.
Pal cannot be copied.
Register a function that returns whether this job has been canceled - PAL calls it during the computation.
remove a layer
set maximum # candidates to generate for lines features Higher the value is, longer Pal::labeller will spend time
set # candidates to generate for points features Higher the value is, longer Pal::labeller will spend time
set maximum # candidates to generate for polygon features Higher the value is, longer Pal::labeller will spend time
Select the search method to use.

detaileddescription.para:
For interactive mapping using CHAIN is a good idea because it is the fastest. Other methods, ordered by speedness, are POPMUSIC_TABU, POPMUSIC_CHAIN and POPMUSIC_TABU_CHAIN, defined in pal::_searchMethod enumeration
method
the method to use

briefdescription.para: Set flag show partial label.
Creates a Problem, by extracting labels and generating candidates from the given extent.

detaileddescription.para: The mapBoundary geometry specifies the actual visible region of the map, and is used for pruning candidates which fall outside the visible region.

briefdescription.para: Returns the maximum number of iterations allowed for POPMUSIC_TABU, POPMUSIC_CHAIN and POPMUSIC_TABU_CHAIN.
Returns the minimum number of iterations used for POPMUSIC_TABU, POPMUSIC_CHAIN and POPMUSIC_TABU_CHAIN.
How many candidates will be tested by a tabu iteration.

parameterdescription.para: the ration (0..1) of candidates to test

briefdescription.para: For *CHAIN, select the max size of a transformation chain.

parameterdescription.para: maximum soze of a transformation chain

briefdescription.para: maximum # of iteration for search method POPMUSIC_TABU, POPMUSIC_CHAIN and POPMUSIC_TABU_CHAIN

parameterdescription.para: Sub part optimization max # of iteration

briefdescription.para: minimum # of iteration for search method POPMUSIC_TABU, POPMUSIC_CHAIN and POPMUSIC_TABU_CHAIN

parameterdescription.para: Sub part optimization min # of iteration

briefdescription.para: Choose the size of popmusic subpart's.
For tabu search : how many iteration a feature will be tabu.

parameterdescription.para: consiser a feature as tabu for tenure iteration after updating feature in solution

briefdescription.para: Main Pal labeling class.

detaileddescription.para: A pal object will contains layers and global information such as which search method will be used.
